question: A 42-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of a 2-day history of dyspnea, chest pain, and hemoptysis that were preceded by 4 days of myalgia and a low-grade fever. He is currently visiting the United States as a tourist from Turkey, where he works at a factory that processes sheep wool and hide. An x-ray of the chest shows widening of the mediastinum. A sputum culture grows gram-positive rods in gray colonies that have irregular margins with wavy projections on microscopy. Which of the following virulence factors of the causal organism increased its survival in host tissue?
question_persian: مردی ۴۲ ساله به دلیل سابقه ۲ روزه تنگی نفس، درد قفسه سینه و خلط خونی که پس از ۴ روز میالژی و تب خفیف رخ داده بود، به بخش اورژانس آورده شده است. او در حال حاضر به عنوان یک توریست از ترکیه به ایالات متحده آمده است، جایی که در یک کارخانه فرآوری پشم و پوست گوسفند کار می‌کند. عکس‌برداری با اشعه ایکس از قفسه سینه نشان‌دهنده گشاد شدن مدیاستن است. کشت خلط، میله‌های گرم مثبت را در کلونی‌های خاکستری با حاشیه‌های نامنظم وتظاهرات موجی در میکروسکوپ نشان می‌دهد. کدام یک از عوامل بیماری‌زای ارگانیسم باعث افزایش بقای آن در بافت میزبان شده است؟
new_question_stem: A 42-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of a 2-day history of dyspnea, chest pain, and hemoptysis that were preceded by 4 days of myalgia and a low-grade fever. He is currently visiting the United States as a tourist from Turkey, where he works at a factory that processes sheep wool and hide. An x-ray of the chest shows widening of the mediastinum. A sputum culture grows gram-positive rods in gray colonies that have irregular margins with wavy projections on microscopy. Which of the following virulence factors of the causal organism increased its survival in host tissue?

question: A 26-year-old woman comes to the clinic for an annual wellness examination. She is healthy with no prior history of significant illness. She exercises 3-4 times a week and eats a plant-based diet with no carbonated drinks. When asked if anything is bothering her, she reports that she has been having recurring episodes of sneezing, congestion, and itchy eyes for the past year. She denies any fever, sick contacts, cough, headaches, chest pain, urinary symptoms, or constipation/diarrhea during these episodes. She is told to take a medication to alleviate her symptoms as needed. What is the likely mechanism of action of the medication in question?
question_persian: یک زن ۲۶ ساله برای معاینه سالانه سلامتی به کلینیک مراجعه می‌کند. او سالم است و تاریخچه بیماری قابل توجهی ندارد. او ۳-۴ بار در هفته ورزش می‌کند و رژیم غذایی گیاهی بدون نوشیدنی‌های گازدار دارد. وقتی از او پرسیده می‌شود آیا چیزی او را اذیت می‌کند، گزارش می‌دهد که در طول سال گذشته دوره‌های تکراری عطسه، احتقان و خارش چشم داشته است. او تب، تماس با افراد بیمار، سرفه، سردرد، درد قفسه سینه، علائم ادراری یا یبوست/اسهال را در طول این دوره‌ها انکار می‌کند. به او گفته می‌شود که دارویی برای کاهش علائم خود در صورت نیاز مصرف کند. مکانیسم احتمالی عمل داروی مورد نظر چیست؟
new_question_stem: A 26-year-old woman comes to the clinic for an annual wellness examination. She is healthy with no prior history of significant illness. She exercises 3-4 times a week and eats a plant-based diet with no carbonated drinks. When asked if anything is bothering her, she reports that she has been having recurring episodes of sneezing, congestion, and itchy eyes for the past year. She denies any fever, sick contacts, cough, headaches, chest pain, urinary symptoms, or constipation/diarrhea during these episodes. She is told to take a medication to alleviate her symptoms as needed. What is the likely mechanism of action of the medication in question?

question: A previously healthy 52-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department after sustaining burns over 45% of her body in a house fire. On arrival, she is in acute distress but is fully oriented. Aggressive intravenous fluid resuscitation is begun and the patient is transferred to the intensive care unit of a burn center. 20 hours later, she has several large, tarry black stools and develops hypotension and tachycardia. Despite appropriate lifesaving measures, she dies. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of the patient's tarry black stools?
question_persian: یک زن ۵۲ ساله که قبلاً سالم بود، به دلیل سوختگی 45 درصدی در یک سانحه آتش سوزی در خانه، به بخش اورژانس آورده می‌شود. در زمان ورود، او در وضعیت حاد استرس قرار دارد اما کاملاً هوشیار است. احیای مایعات به صورت تهاجمی از طریق داخل وریدی آغاز می‌شود و بیمار به واحد مراقبت‌های ویژه مرکز سوختگی منتقل می‌شود. ۲۰ ساعت بعد، او چندین مدفوع بزرگ و سیاه رنگ قیری دارد و دچار افت فشار خون و تاکی کاردی می‌شود. علیرغم اقدامات نجات‌بخش مناسب، او می‌میرد. کدام یک از موارد زیر به احتمال زیاد علت زمینه‌ای مدفوع سیاه قیری بیمار است؟

options.C: Bacterial colonization of the gastric antrum

new_question_stem: A previously healthy 52-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department after sustaining burns over 45% of her body in a house fire. On arrival, she is in acute distress but is fully oriented. Aggressive intravenous fluid resuscitation is begun and the patient is transferred to the intensive care unit of a burn center. 20 hours later, she has several large, tarry black stools and develops hypotension and tachycardia. Despite appropriate lifesaving measures, she dies. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of the patient's tarry black stools?

question: A 44-year-old man comes to the clinic because of a 6-month history of progressive fatigue. He has a history of intravenous heroin use. Physical examination shows scleral icterus. A serum study is positive for hepatitis C RNA. Therapy with interferon-α is initiated in combination with a second drug. The expected beneficial effect of the additional drug is most likely due to inhibition of which of the following enzymes?
question_persian: مردی ۴۴ ساله به دلیل سابقه ۶ ماهه خستگی پیش‌رونده به کلینیک مراجعه می‌کند. او سابقه استفاده از هروئین تزریقی دارد. معاینه فیزیکی نشان می‌دهد که او دچار زردی صلبیه است. مطالعه سرمی نشان می‌دهد که RNA ویروس هپاتیت C مثبت است. درمان با اینترفرون-آلفا به همراه داروی دوم آغاز می‌شود. اثر مفید مورد انتظار از داروی اضافی به احتمال زیاد به دلیل مهار کدام یک از آنزیم‌های زیر است؟
new_question_stem: A 44-year-old man comes to the clinic because of a 6-month history of progressive fatigue. He has a history of intravenous heroin use. Physical examination shows scleral icterus. A serum study is positive for hepatitis C RNA. Therapy with interferon-α is initiated in combination with a second drug. The expected beneficial effect of the additional drug is most likely due to inhibition of which of the following enzymes?

question: The menses are 4 weeks overdue in a 23-year-old sexually active woman, thus she is scheduled for an ultrasound examination. The result is shown in the exhibit. What is the function of the structure marked with the green arrow?
question_persian: عادت ماهانه یک خانم ۲۳ ساله که فعالیت جنسی دارد، ۴ هفته دیر شده است، بنابراین او برای یک آزمایش سونوگرافی برنامه‌ریزی شده است. نتیجه در تصویر نمایش داده شده است. عملکرد ساختاری که با پیکان سبز علامت‌گذاری شده چیست؟
new_question_stem: The menses are 4 weeks overdue in a 23-year-old sexually active woman, thus she is scheduled for an ultrasound examination. The result is shown in the exhibit. What is the function of the structure marked with the green arrow?

question: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of an irregular gait 3 days after receiving age-appropriate vaccinations. Examination of the lower extremities shows no redness or swelling. When the child stands on his right leg, his left leg drops and his pelvis tilts towards the left. Sensation to light touch is normal in both legs. This patient's symptoms are most likely due to the injection of the vaccine into which of the following locations?
question_persian: یک پسر ۵ ساله به دلیل ناهنجاری در راه رفتن، ۳ روز پس از دریافت واکسن‌های مناسب سن، به پزشک مراجعه کرده است. معاینه اندام‌های تحتانی هیچ قرمزی یا تورمی نشان نمی‌دهد. هنگامی که کودک روی پای راست خود می‌ایستد، پای چپ او افتاده و لگنش به سمت چپ متمایل می‌شود. حس لامسه سبک در هر دو پا طبیعی است. علائم این بیمار به احتمال زیاد به دلیل تزریق واکسن در کدام یک از مکان‌های زیر است؟
answer: Superomedial quadrant of the right buttock

options.A: Inferolateral quadrant of the right buttock
options.B: Inferomedial quadrant of the right buttock
options.C: Inferomedial quadrant of the left buttock
options.D: Superomedial quadrant of the right buttock
options.E: Inferolateral quadrant of the left buttock

options_persian.A: بخش تحتانی و جانبی باسن راست

new_question_stem: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of an irregular gait 3 days after receiving age-appropriate vaccinations. Examination of the lower extremities shows no redness or swelling. When the child stands on his right leg, his left leg drops and his pelvis tilts towards the left. Sensation to light touch is normal in both legs. This patient's symptoms are most likely due to the injection of the vaccine into which of the following locations?

question: A 3550-g (7.8-lb) male newborn is delivered at term to a 27-year-old, gravida 1, para 1 woman (Rh+). Within the first 24 hours after birth, the newborn develops fever and a yellow discoloration of skin and sclerae. Examination shows loss of flexion in the extremities, splenomegaly, and cyanosis. Laboratory studies show decreased haptoglobin levels and increased LDH levels. A photomicrograph of a peripheral blood smear is shown. Which of the following is most likely involved in the pathogenesis of this patient's condition?
question_persian: نوزاد ذکور 3550 گرمی (7.8 پوندی) در زمان ترم به دنیا آمده و مادر او زن 27 ساله، گراویدا 1، پارا 1 (Rh+) است. در طی 24 ساعت اول پس از تولد، نوزاد تب کرده و پوست و سفیدی چشم‌هایش زرد می‌شود. معاینه نشان می‌دهد که انعطاف‌پذیری اندام‌ها کاهش یافته، بزرگی طحال و سیانوز وجود دارد. آزمایش‌های آزمایشگاهی نشان می‌دهند که سطح هاپتوگلوبین کاهش یافته و سطح LDH افزایش یافته است. یک میکروفوتوگراف از اسمیر خون محیطی نشان داده شده است. کدام یک از موارد زیر به احتمال زیاد در پاتوژنز وضعیت این بیمار دخیل است؟

options.A: Decrease in the reduced form of glutathione
options.B: Maternal antibodies against the rhesus D antigen

options_persian.A: کاهش در فرم احیا شده گلوتاتیون
options_persian.B: پادتن‌های مادری علیه آنتی‌ژن رزوس D
options_persian.E: گلبول‌های قرمز شکننده به دلیل اسمزی

new_question_stem: A 3550-g (7.8-lb) male newborn is delivered at term to a 27-year-old, gravida 1, para 1 woman (Rh+). Within the first 24 hours after birth, the newborn develops fever and a yellow discoloration of skin and sclerae. Examination shows loss of flexion in the extremities, splenomegaly, and cyanosis. Laboratory studies show decreased haptoglobin levels and increased LDH levels. A photomicrograph of a peripheral blood smear is shown. Which of the following is most likely involved in the pathogenesis of this patient's condition?

question: An otherwise healthy 26-year-old man comes to the physician for medication counseling after recently being diagnosed with schizophrenia. Risperidone therapy is initiated. This patient is at increased risk for which of the following adverse effects?
question_persian: مرد ۲۶ ساله‌ای که به‌جز این مسئله، سالم است، برای مشاوره دارویی پس از تشخیص اخیر اسکیزوفرنی به پزشک مراجعه می‌کند. درمان با ریسپریدون آغاز می‌شود. این بیمار در معرض خطر افزایش یافته کدامیک از عوارض جانبی زیر است؟
new_question_stem: An otherwise healthy 26-year-old man comes to the physician for medication counseling after recently being diagnosed with schizophrenia. Risperidone therapy is initiated. This patient is at increased risk for which of the following adverse effects?
additional_correct_answer: Hyperprolactinemia; Amenorrhea; Galactorrhea; Erectile dysfunction; Ejaculatory dysfunction; Extrapyramidal side effects

question: A 47-year-old female undergoes a thyroidectomy for treatment of Graves' disease. Post-operatively, she reports a hoarse voice and difficulty speaking. You suspect that this is likely a complication of her recent surgery. What is the embryologic origin of the damaged nerve that is most likely causing this patient's hoarseness?
question_persian: یک زن ۴۷ ساله تحت عمل جراحی تیروئیدکتومی برای درمان بیماری گریوز قرار می‌گیرد. پس از عمل، او از صدای خشن و دشواری در صحبت کردن شکایت می‌کند. شما مشکوک هستید که این احتمالاً یک عارضه از جراحی اخیر او باشد. منشأ جنینی عصبی که به احتمال زیاد باعث خشونت صدای این بیمار شده است، چیست؟
new_question_stem: A 47-year-old female undergoes a thyroidectomy for treatment of Graves' disease. Post-operatively, she reports a hoarse voice and difficulty speaking. You suspect that this is likely a complication of her recent surgery. What is the embryologic origin of the damaged nerve that is most likely causing this patient's hoarseness?

question: A 75-year-old man is admitted to the hospital because of a 3-day history of a productive cough and shortness of breath. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F) and respirations are 32/min. Crackles are heard over the right upper and the entire left lung fields. Sputum culture confirms infection with Streptococcus pneumoniae. Despite appropriate therapy, the patient dies. A photomicrograph of a section of the lung obtained during the autopsy is shown. Which of the following mediators is most likely responsible for the presence of the cell-type indicated by the arrow?
question_persian: مردی ۷۵ ساله به دلیل داشتن سرفه مولد و تنگی نفس به مدت ۳ روز به بیمارستان آورده شده است. دمای بدن او ۳۸ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۱۰۰.۴ درجه فارنهایت) و تعداد تنفس او ۳۲ در دقیقه است. صدای خرخر بر روی ناحیه فوقانی راست و تمام ناحیه ریه چپ شنیده می‌شود. کشت خلط، عفونت با استرپتوکوک پنومونیه را تأیید می‌کند. با وجود درمان مناسب، بیمار جان خود را از دست می‌دهد. میکروگرافی از یک بخش ریه که در طول کالبدشکافی گرفته شده است نشان داده شده است. کدام‌یک از میانجی‌های زیر به احتمال زیاد مسئول حضور نوع سلولی است که توسط فلش نشان داده شده است؟
new_question_stem: A 75-year-old man is admitted to the hospital because of a 3-day history of a productive cough and shortness of breath. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F) and respirations are 32/min. Crackles are heard over the right upper and the entire left lung fields. Sputum culture confirms infection with Streptococcus pneumoniae. Despite appropriate therapy, the patient dies. A photomicrograph of a section of the lung obtained during the autopsy is shown. Which of the following mediators is most likely responsible for the presence of the cell-type indicated by the arrow?

question: A 20-year-old healthy man is running on a treadmill for the last 30 minutes. He is in good shape and exercises 3 times per week. He takes no medications and denies smoking cigarettes, drinking alcohol, and illicit drug use. Prior to starting his run, his heart rate was 70/min, and the blood pressure was 114/74 mm Hg. Immediately after stopping his run, the heart rate is 130/min, and the blood pressure is 145/75 mm Hg. Which of the following is most likely responsible for the change in his heart rate and blood pressure?
question_persian: مردی ۲۰ ساله و سالم به مدت ۳۰ دقیقه روی تردمیل در حال دویدن است. او در وضعیت بدنی خوبی قرار دارد و هفته‌ای ۳ بار ورزش می‌کند. او هیچ دارویی مصرف نمی‌کند و مصرف سیگار، الکل و مواد مخدر را رد می‌کند. پیش از شروع دویدن، ضربان قلب او ۷۰ بار در دقیقه و فشار خون او ۱۱۴/۷۴ میلی‌متر جیوه بود. بلافاصله پس از توقف دویدن، ضربان قلب او ۱۳۰ بار در دقیقه و فشار خون او ۱۴۵/۷۵ میلی‌متر جیوه است. کدام یک از موارد زیر به احتمال زیاد مسئول تغییر ضربان قلب و فشار خون او است؟

options.B: Increased activation of the vagal nuclei

new_question_stem: A 20-year-old healthy man is running on a treadmill for the last 30 minutes. He is in good shape and exercises 3 times per week. He takes no medications and denies smoking cigarettes, drinking alcohol, and illicit drug use. Prior to starting his run, his heart rate was 70/min, and the blood pressure was 114/74 mm Hg. Immediately after stopping his run, the heart rate is 130/min, and the blood pressure is 145/75 mm Hg. Which of the following is most likely responsible for the change in his heart rate and blood pressure?

question: A 81-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after he fell asleep at the dinner table and was not able to be roused by his family. His past medical history is significant for Alzheimer disease though he is still relatively functional at baseline. He has also been taking warfarin over the last 3 months after he suffered a deep venous thrombosis. After he was transported to the ED, his family found that the pills his grandson takes for seizures were missing. On presentation, he is found to be somnolent and physical exam reveals ataxia and nystagmus. After determining the cause of this patient's symptoms, his physicians begin monitoring his international normalized ratio, because they are concerned that it will start trending down. Which of the following treatments would most improve the urinary excretion of the substance likely responsible for these symptoms?
question_persian: یک مرد ۸۱ ساله به بخش اورژانس منتقل شده است بعد از اینکه در سر میز شام به خواب رفت و خانواده‌اش نتوانستند او را بیدار کنند. سابقه پزشکی او شامل بیماری آلزایمر است، اگرچه در حالت عادی هنوز نسبتاً کارآمد است. او همچنین در سه ماه گذشته بعد از ابتلا به ترومبوز ورید عمقی، وارفارین مصرف می‌کرد. بعد از انتقال او به بخش اورژانس، خانواده‌اش متوجه شدند که قرص‌هایی که نوه‌اش برای تشنج مصرف می‌کند، ناپدید شده‌اند. هنگام معاینه، او خواب‌آلود است و معاینه فیزیکی آتاکسی و نیستاگموس را نشان می‌دهد. پس از تعیین علت علائم این بیمار، پزشکان شروع به نظارت بر نسبت نرمال شده بین‌المللی (INR) او می‌کنند، زیرا نگران این هستند که این نسبت شروع به کاهش کند. کدام یک از درمان‌های زیر بیشترین بهبود را در دفع ادراری ماده‌ای که به احتمال زیاد مسئول این علائم است، خواهد داشت؟
new_question_stem: A 81-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after he fell asleep at the dinner table and was not able to be roused by his family. His past medical history is significant for Alzheimer disease though he is still relatively functional at baseline. He has also been taking warfarin over the last 3 months after he suffered a deep venous thrombosis. After he was transported to the ED, his family found that the pills his grandson takes for seizures were missing. On presentation, he is found to be somnolent and physical exam reveals ataxia and nystagmus. After determining the cause of this patient's symptoms, his physicians begin monitoring his international normalized ratio, because they are concerned that it will start trending down. Which of the following treatments would most improve the urinary excretion of the substance likely responsible for these symptoms?

question: An 8-year-old boy who recently immigrated to the United States presents with a rash. Past medical history is significant for a recent sore throat which caused him to miss several days at school. The patient’s vaccination status is unknown. On physical examination, the patient is pale and ill-looking. There are pink rings present on the torso and inner surfaces of the limbs. Cardiac exam is significant for a holosystolic murmur heard best over the apex of the heart. Which of the following histopathologic findings is most likely associated with this patient’s condition?
question_persian: یک پسر ۸ ساله که به تازگی به ایالات متحده مهاجرت کرده است با یک بثورات پوستی مراجعه می‌کند. سابقه پزشکی او شامل یک گلودرد اخیر است که باعث شده چندین روز از مدرسه غیبت کند. وضعیت واکسیناسیون بیمار نامشخص است. در معاینه فیزیکی، بیمار رنگ‌پریده و بدحال به نظر می‌رسد. حلقه‌های صورتی روی تنه و سطح داخلی اندام‌ها مشاهده می‌شود. در معاینه قلب، سوفل هولوسیستولیک که در ناحیه راس قلب بهتر شنیده می‌شود، قابل توجه است. کدام یک از یافته‌های هیستوپاتولوژیک زیر به احتمال زیاد با وضعیت این بیمار مرتبط است؟

options.A: Atypical lymphocytes on peripheral blood smear

options_persian.A: لنفوسیت‌های غیرمعمول در لام خون محیطی
options_persian.C: رسوبات بلوری سوزنی شکل با دوشکست منفی

new_question_stem: An 8-year-old boy who recently immigrated to the United States presents with a rash. Past medical history is significant for a recent sore throat which caused him to miss several days at school. The patient’s vaccination status is unknown. On physical examination, the patient is pale and ill-looking. There are pink rings present on the torso and inner surfaces of the limbs. Cardiac exam is significant for a holosystolic murmur heard best over the apex of the heart. Which of the following histopathologic findings is most likely associated with this patient’s condition?

question: A 27-year-old male suddenly develops severe abdominal cramping and bloody diarrhea. The patient reports consuming undercooked ground beef four days prior to the onset of the symptoms. Which of the following best describes the toxin-mediated mechanism of this disease process?
question_persian: یک مرد ۲۷ ساله به طور ناگهانی دچار گرفتگی شدید شکم و اسهال خونی می‌شود. بیمار گزارش می‌دهد که چهار روز قبل از شروع علائم، گوشت چرخ کرده کاملا پخته نشده مصرف کرده است. کدام‌یک از موارد زیر به بهترین وجه مکانیسم بیماری‌زایی مبتنی بر توکسین را توصیف می‌کند؟پ
answer: Inhibition of the 60S ribosomal subunit, resulting in decreased protein synthesis in gastrointestinal mucosal cells
answer_persian: مهار زیرواحد ریبوزومی 60S، که منجر به کاهش سنتز پروتئین در سلول‌های مخاطی دستگاه گوارش می‌شود.

options.A: Depolymerization of actin filaments in gastrointestinal mucosal cells, leading to mucosal cell death
options.B: Increased pH of gastrointestinal lumen resulting in reduced mucosal absorption
options.C: Increased intracellular cAMP in gastrointestinal mucosal cells, resulting in decreased absorption and increased secretion in the digestive tract
options.D: Inhibition of elongation factor-2 (EF-2), resulting in decreased protein synthesis in gastrointestinal mucosal cells
options.E: Inhibition of the 60S ribosomal subunit, resulting in decreased protein synthesis in gastrointestinal mucosal cells

options_persian.A: دپلیمریزاسیون رشته‌های اکتین در سلول‌های مخاطی دستگاه گوارش، که منجر به مرگ سلول‌های مخاطی می‌شود.
options_persian.B: افزایش pH لومن دستگاه گوارش منجر به کاهش جذب مخاطی می‌شود.
options_persian.C: افزایش cAMP داخل سلولی در سلول‌های مخاطی دستگاه گوارش، که منجر به کاهش جذب و افزایش ترشح در مجرای گوارشی می‌شود.
options_persian.D: بازداری فاکتور طویل‌شدن-2 (EF-2) که منجر به کاهش سنتز پروتئین در سلول‌های مخاط دستگاه گوارش می‌شود.
options_persian.E: مهار زیرواحد ریبوزومی 60S که منجر به کاهش سنتز پروتئین در سلول‌های مخاطی دستگاه گوارش می‌شود.

new_question_stem: A 27-year-old male suddenly develops severe abdominal cramping and bloody diarrhea. The patient reports consuming undercooked ground beef four days prior to the onset of the symptoms. Which of the following best describes the toxin-mediated mechanism of this disease process?

question: A 52-year-old woman presents to the emergency department due to severe pain of her first metatarsophalangeal (MTP) joint. This pain started acutely, and she describes the pain as sharp. Her medical history is significant for obesity, hypertension, inflammatory bowel disease, and extensive alcohol use. She takes a number of medications but does not remember what they are. On physical exam, her right first MTP joint appears warm, swollen, erythematous, and exquisitely painful to the touch. After resolution of this acute episode, the patient is started on a drug to prevent recurrence of the symptoms. One month later on follow-up, she is found to have pancytopenia. Which of the following describes the mechanism of the drug most likely prescribed in this case?
question_persian: زنی ۵۲ ساله به دلیل درد شدید در مفصل متاتارسوفالانژیال (MTP) اول خود به بخش اورژانس مراجعه می‌کند. این درد به طور ناگهانی شروع شده و او درد را به صورت تیز توصیف می‌کند. سابقه پزشکی او شامل چاقی، فشار خون بالا، بیماری التهابی روده و مصرف زیاد الکل است. او داروهای متعددی مصرف می‌کند اما نام آن‌ها را به خاطر ندارد. در معاینه فیزیکی، مفصل MTP اول پای راست او گرم، متورم، اریتماتوز و بسیار دردناک به لمس است. پس از رفع این دوره حاد، بیمار برای جلوگیری از عود علائم دارویی را شروع می‌کند. یک ماه بعد در پیگیری، مشخص می‌شود که او دچار پان‌سیتوپنی شده است. کدام یک از موارد زیر مکانیزم دارویی را که احتمالاً در این مورد تجویز شده است، توصیف می‌کند؟
new_question_stem: A 52-year-old woman presents to the emergency department due to severe pain of her first metatarsophalangeal (MTP) joint. This pain started acutely, and she describes the pain as sharp. Her medical history is significant for obesity, hypertension, inflammatory bowel disease, and extensive alcohol use. She takes a number of medications but does not remember what they are. On physical exam, her right first MTP joint appears warm, swollen, erythematous, and exquisitely painful to the touch. After resolution of this acute episode, the patient is started on a drug to prevent recurrence of the symptoms. One month later on follow-up, she is found to have pancytopenia. Which of the following describes the mechanism of the drug most likely prescribed in this case?
